members.member:
Parses a full name string into first and last name
The full name to parse A one or two element string array that contains: 1) A single element when there is only a single name in fullName 2) The first and middle names in element 0 and the last name in element 1 3) If the name ends with recognizable suffix then the first and middle names in element 0 and the last name and suffix in element 1

member.name: T:MbcsCentral.DragCanvas
member.summary: A Canvas which manages dragging of the UIElements it contains.

member.name: M:MbcsCentral.DragCanvas.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of DragCanvas. UIElements in the DragCanvas will immediately be draggable by the user.

member.name: P:MbcsCentral.DragCanvas.AllowDragging
member.summary: Gets/sets whether elements in the DragCanvas should be draggable by the user. The default value is true. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:MbcsCentral.DragCanvas.AllowDragOutOfView
member.summary: Gets/sets whether the user should be able to drag elements in the DragCanvas out of the viewable area. The default value is false. This is a dependency property.

member.name: M:MbcsCentral.DragCanvas.BringToFront(System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Assigns the element a z-index which will ensure that it is in front of every other element in the Canvas. The z-index of every element whose z-index is between the element's old and new z-index will have its z-index decremented by one.
member.param: The element to be sent to the front of the z-order.

member.name: M:MbcsCentral.DragCanvas.SendToBack(System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Assigns the element a z-index which will ensure that it is behind every other element in the Canvas. The z-index of every element whose z-index is between the element's old and new z-index will have its z-index incremented by one.
member.param: The element to be sent to the back of the z-order.

member.name: P:MbcsCentral.DragCanvas.ElementBeingDragged
member.summary: Returns the UIElement currently being dragged, or null.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: This property exposes a protected setter which should be used to modify the drag element.

member.name: M:MbcsCentral.DragCanvas.FindCanvasChild(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Walks up the visual tree starting with the specified DependencyObject, looking for a UIElement which is a child of the Canvas. If a suitable element is not found, null is returned. If the 'depObj' object is a UIElement in the Canvas's Children collection, it will be returned.
member.param: A DependencyObject from which the search begins.

member.name: M:MbcsCentral.DragCanvas.CalculateDragElementRect(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a Rect which describes the bounds of the element being dragged.

member.name: M:MbcsCentral.DragCanvas.ResolveOffset(System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Determines one component of a UIElement's location within a Canvas (either the horizontal or vertical offset).
member.param: The value of an offset relative to a default side of the Canvas (i.e. top or left).
The value of the offset relative to the other side of the Canvas (i.e. bottom or right).
Will be set to true if the returned value should be used for the offset from the side represented by the 'side1' parameter. Otherwise, it will be set to false.

member.name: M:MbcsCentral.DragCanvas.UpdateZOrder(System.Windows.UIElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Helper method used by the BringToFront and SendToBack methods.
member.param: The element to bring to the front or send to the back.
Pass true if calling from BringToFront, else false.

member.name: T:MbcsCentral.StartReport
member.summary:
A class that facilitates the processing of background reports.
Usage:
The class for the report to be printed must inherit the abstract class: ReportBase
and contain a method as follows:
public override void Process(){}
that either kicks off the report processing or calls the method that does.
The class or window that initiates the report first encapsulates any constructor
variables in an object array: object[] parms = {arg1, arg2, arg3};.
These must be the same type and in the same order as the report class' constructor
argument list.
Then the initiating class/window makes the call: StartReport.Start(reportClass, parms)
where 'reportClass' is the fully qualified report class such as:
StartReport.Start("MbcsCentral.WinPM.StatusReport", parms)

member.name: M:MbcsCentral.StartReport.Start(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets up variables for report, create report thread and start it
member.param: The full Namespace of the report object to process
Array of arguments that match a constructor in the report object

member.name: M:MbcsCentral.StartReport.ReportThread(System.Object)
member.summary: This is the entry point for the report thread Notice that it instantiates the class for the report and calls the abstract method Process which must, of course, exist in the report class and be the starting method there.
member.param: Array of arguments for the report object. The first argument is the name of the report class to process.
